pageContext.description: An incomplete copper alloy tanged chisel dating to the late Bronze Age (c. 1150 - 800 BC). The chisel has a tang with a rectangular cross section which has broken 5.3mm from a transverse collar. This collar is sub-oval in cross-section and is 10.8mm wide. The blade itself expands from 8.1mm wide at the collar to 21.3mm wide at the cutting edge, which is noticeably asymmetrical, possibly from wear during use or post depositional corrosion.
pageContext.notes: Tanged chisels of this type are uncommon finds; examples recorded on the database include BH-49EAD8, NMS-5059F9 and BERK-52E8C3.
